task_summary: A robot arm pours a liquid from a cup into a mug on a table.

task_long_description.overview: In this episode, a robot arm executes a pouring task, transferring contents from a cup (held in its gripper) into a mug positioned on a table. The robot employs visual feedback to locate the mug, approaches and aligns with it, and performs a controlled pour via a tilt, ensuring the transfer is safe and complete. The system operates in a structured environment with few obstructions, prioritizing precision and avoidance of spillage, then retreats after pouring.
preconditions: Mug is present on the table within the robot's workspace
Robot is holding a cup containing pourable material
Workspace is unobstructed for arm movement
stepwise_plan: Locate and verify visibility of the mug
Move the cup above and close to the mug
Pour contents by tilting the cup above the mug
Return to a safe position after pouring
success_criteria: Contents of the cup successfully poured into the mug
No major spillage outside the mug
Robot arm and objects remain undamaged
failure_and_recovery: If mug not detected, retry scanning up to three times
If pour fails (contents remain in cup), raise error and halt
task_long_description.termination: Task completes after pouring and retreating from the mug

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the mug can be seen by the vision system.
Attempts a raster scan to locate the mug with up to 3 tries.
Performs object detection to refine mug position.
Moves the held cup to a position directly above the mug at 10cm height.
Pours entirety of cup contents into mug by tilting 90 degrees at normal rate.
Moves the arm back by 10cm after pouring.

failure_modes: Robot misaligns above mug, risking spillage
Pour fails due to insufficient tilt or blockage
Collision with mug or table surface
recovery_strategy: Retry scanning for mug up to 3 times
assumptions: The source vessel is a 'cup' held by the robot, despite the instruction not specifying the source.
Frames confirm a cup is held and poured into a mug, although the instruction omits the source.

expected_success_criteria: All contents of the cup are poured into the mug without spill
Frame sequence covers the full pouring process
